text: Thann is a commune in Alsace in north-eastern France, in the Haut-Rhin department, of which it is a subprefecture. It is in the Grand Est region. The commmune is in the historical and cultural region of Alsace. The name of the town comes from the German word tanne that means fir; there is a fir in the coat of arms of Thann. ==Geography== Thann is in the southwest of the Haut- Rhin department at the foot of the Vosges mountains, at the mouth of the valley of the Thur river. The Thur runs through the middle of the town. It has an area of . Its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . Thann is at from Strasbourg, the regional capital; at from Colmar, the departamental capital; and at from Mulhouse. Thann and its neighboring communes The commune of Thann is surrounded by the communes Goldbach- Altenbach, Vieux-Thann, Leimbach and Bitschwiller-lès-Thann. ===Climate=== The climate of Thann, in the Köppen climate classification, is Cfb - Oceanic climate with template summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Thann are known, in French, as Thannois (women: Thannoises). With a population of 7,915, Thann has a population density of inhabitants/km2. It is the capital of the Thann-Guebwiller arrondissement. It is in the Cernay canton. It is part of the intercommunality Thann-Cernay. === Twin towns === Thann is twinned with: * - Gubbio, Italy * - Tonneins, France * - Bafia, Cameroon ==Gallery== File:Thann 09.jpg|Saint- Thiébaut fountain.
